text: When I go online, I see hate speech everywhere. Usually it's about race or religion. And I've seen this all on social media. Facebook, YouTube. I've definitely seen hate speech in comment sections. Basically every single platform, there's always is that one racist or sexist comment that's always going to be there. Do you have to go very far to find it? I don't have a need to go digging for it. It's everywhere. I define hate speech as anything that's threatening or meant to hurt somebody else. Anything you say or do that is kind of like attacking any part of someone. What is what they look like, their belief. I'm not sure of the exact definition of hate speech. Any way you use your words to oppress or harm somebody else. It doesn't necessarily have to be a derogatory term or slur. It could just be word that we use in our everyday sentences. The meaning of it has become really big or at least really wide. Someone is no longer just being offensive when what they're saying is marginalizing or hurting a whole community of people. For example, their religion, their race. If that's what you're going for, that's no longer just you being mean. That's hate speech. I have definitely encountered hate speech online. I found it a lot more on social media than I have in real life. I see it in maybe comments on YouTube videos or tweets on Twitter. Twitter has a huge amount of hate speech. It's such an open platform for people to just type down what they think and send it off. I definitely think YouTube is one of the places where you most see racist or sexist comments. I've noticed it mostly on social media platforms like Instagram and YouTube. Through jokes, I tend to see it on memes or funny posts are meant to be funny posts. And I think it's that those type of people that they'll say over social media, but they won't say it in person because they're too afraid and they don't want to own up to having that kind of ideology. I don't think it's a joke to me. If it's racist, then they post it to be racist because that's what they're thinking about. Some close friends of mine from middle school actually created a private Instagram account and they used it to post racist ableist sexist xenophobic pictures. Last year, someone created the extremely antisemitic Instagram account and it was always so personal and so targeted. And I wish I could say that was the last time that something like that had happened in our school, but it isn't. It made me kind of question my place and like where I belong in the school because it's supposed to be our sanctuary space. And students within this very building in the same classrooms as me, are posting photos that dehumanize me. It was hurting. I think that people are posting hate speech online because for the first part, it's easier for people to talk through a screen. It's almost like a sheet in front of you or you can cover your face but sound still goes through So people can say whatever they want Kind of get away with it. I do think that xenophobia is one factor to why people use hate speech. Part of it is just to get a reaction or part of it is just to get attention. The people who put These types of posts on media, they seem to be going through something themselves. It's maybe because of their past or they've been hurt before and they want to hurt others to make them feel better about themselves. I've never seen someone post hate speech Being a friendly person who is just trying to say their opinion. I think the Hays speech is put out there Just to target a certain group. There's such a large platform that so many people could see that it's really easy to get your message across and people are going to read it Because it's on social media. So when I see something on my timeline I go out of my way to report it. I go out of my way to stop that Because I know somebody else isn't going to take it the same way that I do. How do you feel? Like somebody's talking like some negative things about you that it hurts your feelings? Yeah, I feel a sort of social responsibility we all should be lifting each other up Rather than putting each other down. When I see people posting racist things online, I just don't do nothing about it Because I feel like I asked myself, what can I do to stop this? I can't really do anything about it kind of just have to ignore it. It's really hurtful to the other person. I don't think they realize it. It really demoralizes them and lowers their self esteem. I would report hate speech When I see it when we see these posts on our timelines or on our Instagrams in our feeds, Twitter, Snapchat, even group chats we feel the need to speak out and when we speak out we give those people who hurt us that attention that they always craved. I feel like if you don't have anything good to say, don't say it. Everyone always argues with these people And I do too. I think people are free to express what they have to say But I don't think it should be at the cost of putting somebody else down.
